Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: All about Arthropods!! Now an expert
I LEARNED SO MUCH I CAN NAME ORDER OR FAMILY OF ANY BUG !!!!! YAAAYYYY i also like am an entomologist now for real. I can kill jar any bug any day.
Everything relating to arthropods; taxonomy, biology, and how to handle live and dead specimens.

I learned so much in this class! I became completely fearless of all arthropods, and I can identify any terrestrial arthropod by looking at it. I learned how to process and pin insect specimens and curate my own collection!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: i love marta and the TAs and every little bug catcher in the class and although my September was v busy with trip and bug catching getting off campus and going to florida FOR FREE legit so amazing cannot even process 

Did feel stressed lowkey once quizzes hit and bug collection felt overwhelming at times but tbh if you try managing ur stress and just doing ur best studying ur quizlets u will be okay and she puts bonus questions and the knowledge becomes exciting. I did lowkey dedicate my schedule to this class so like if ur a really really busy person and u cant go on the trips or you dont like bugs maybe dont do it. 

Make sure to collect bugs for diversity, 8 spiders, 5 ants, different families, and a focal taxon

It is VERY hard and time consuming. Although it is incredibly rewarding, I feel like a lot of the time we weren't given clear instructions and the expectations were unclear. It didn't matter though because we were all confused. Net neutral.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Trip to Florida? Amazing professor and TAs? Learn all about arthropods? Take it!!
Changed my life highkey but not for everyone.

I would recommend this class to anyone who wants to get experience with field work and handling specimens. It is also a cool party trick to know every bug. Just know that it is a TON of work. It is doable though! I did fine and I took it during a 5 credit semester.
